author: mklement0
body:
On Windows, when you create a substituted drive with `subst.exe` or map a drive with `net.exe use`, `Get-PSDrive`, for the remainder of the session reports _two_ entries under the same name: one lowercase, one uppercase - though it only seems to happen for _certain_ letters.

## Steps to reproduce

On Windows:

```powershell
# The same applies to `net use t: ...`
subst t: C:\Windows && (Get-PSDrive t).Count | Should -Be 1
```

**Note**: Whether this happens seems to depend on the _specific letter used_; at least on my machine, it happens with `T`, but not with `W`, for instance.


## Expected behavior

The test should succeed - there should only be one drive named `t`, irrespective of case.

## Actual behavior

The test fails, because both drive definitions for both `t` (lowercase) and `T`  show up.

```none
Expected 1, but got 2.
```

## Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.1.0-rc.2
```

comments.author: lukeb1961
comments.body: FYI I just tried this on 5.1 and see the same behaviour. (ie 2 x T and 2 x W drives)

comments.author: bcat123456
comments.body:
I have a work around:
Get-PSDrive -Name s | sort-object -unique

```
PS C:\support\Scripts-dont-change> Get-PSDrive -Name s

Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                               CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                               ---------------
S                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\DHCVPUHDI01\wug
s                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\dhcvpuhdi01\wug


PS C:\support\Scripts-dont-change> Get-PSDrive -Name s | sort-object -unique

Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                               CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                               ---------------
s                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\dhcvpuhdi01\wug

```

title: Defining a substituted drive or mapped drive with a lowercase letter causes duplicate output by Get-PSDrive
